About Me

Hello, my name’s Francisco and I’m a third year Engineering Physics student at the University of British Columbia.

Projects

UBC OpenRobotics

ubcopenrobotics.ca

I am a member of the UBC OpenRobotics RoboCup@Home Software Team. Our goal is to develop software to allow our robot to compete in the RoboCup@Home Competition. The competition consists of a variety of tasks such as voice and facial recognition and object and person tracking

Experience

General Fusion

generalfusion.com

Computational Plasma Engineer

January 2019 - April 2019

Integrated Magnetohydrodynamics stability framework OMFIT into physics workflow. Developed additional functionality for OMFIT - including visualization tools, PBS/Torque server compatibility, parallel job submission – which decreased timeline processing by over 100%. Presented DCON stability analysis reports to members of the MHD team weekly.
